title: QUATERNARY NICOTINAMIDE DERVIATIVES AS PRECURSORS FOR RELEASE OF MNA
abstract: The invention concerns pyridine salts derivatives which are O-substituted halides of 3-oxymethylaminocarbonyl-1-methylpyridine and their pharmaceutically acceptable salts. Disclosed compounds may be used as a medicament due to observed release of the active substance - N1-methylnicotinamide (MNA) by these compounds. Preferably compounds are claimed for use in the treatment or prevention of diseases associated with endothelial dysfunction. The invention also concerns the method of MNA release and the use of pyridine salts derivatives for selective release of MNA.

motivations: There is a need for effective treatments or prevention methods for diseases associated with endothelial dysfunction.
Current methods for releasing N1-methylnicotinamide (MNA) may lack selectivity or efficacy.
objectives: Develop pyridine salts derivatives as precursors for the selective release of MNA.
Investigate the potential therapeutic applications of these compounds, particularly in treating or preventing diseases related to endothelial dysfunction.
methods: Design and synthesize O-substituted halides of 3-oxymethylaminocarbonyl-1-methylpyridine and their pharmaceutically acceptable salts.
Evaluate the ability of these compounds to release MNA and assess their potential therapeutic effects.
results: Provide a novel approach for the selective release of MNA, a compound with potential therapeutic benefits.
Offer a potential treatment or prevention strategy for diseases associated with endothelial dysfunction.
llama_json.research_subject: Pyridine salts derivatives as precursors for the release of N1-methylnicotinamide (MNA)

motivations: There is a need for effective precursors for the release of N1-methylnicotinamide (MNA), an active substance with potential therapeutic benefits.
The treatment or prevention of diseases associated with endothelial dysfunction could be improved with the use of such precursors.
objectives: Develop pyridine salts derivatives which are O-substituted halides of 3-oxymethylaminocarbonyl-1-methylpyridine and their pharmaceutically acceptable salts.
Use these compounds for the selective release of MNA.
Explore the potential use of these compounds in the treatment or prevention of diseases associated with endothelial dysfunction.
methods: Synthesize O-substituted halides of 3-oxymethylaminocarbonyl-1-methylpyridine and their pharmaceutically acceptable salts.
Investigate the release of MNA by these compounds.
Evaluate the potential use of these compounds in the treatment or prevention of diseases associated with endothelial dysfunction.
results: Potential development of effective precursors for the release of MNA.
Potential improvement in the treatment or prevention of diseases associated with endothelial dysfunction.
openai_json.research_subject: Development of quaternary nicotinamide derivatives as precursors for release of MNA

motivations: There is a need for effective drug delivery systems that can selectively release N1-methylnicotinamide (MNA) for therapeutic applications.
Endothelial dysfunction-related diseases require novel treatment approaches with improved drug delivery mechanisms.
objectives: Develop pyridine salt derivatives that can serve as precursors for the controlled release of N1-methylnicotinamide (MNA).
Create pharmaceutical compounds for the treatment and prevention of diseases associated with endothelial dysfunction.
methods: Synthesize O-substituted halides of 3-oxymethylaminocarbonyl-1-methylpyridine and their pharmaceutically acceptable salts.
Develop a method for selective MNA release from the pyridine salt derivatives.
results: The compounds demonstrate effective release of the active substance N1-methylnicotinamide (MNA).
The derivatives show potential as medicaments for treating endothelial dysfunction-related diseases.
anthropic_json.research_subject: Quaternary nicotinamide derivatives as precursors for N1-methylnicotinamide release
